  113: -define(EXEC_TIMEOUT, 10000).
  114: 
  115: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  116: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  117: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  118: 
  119: %% suite() ->
  120: %%     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
  121: 
  122: suite() ->
  123:     [{timetrap,{seconds,40}}].
  124: 
  125: all() ->
  126:     [
  127:      {group, openssh},
  128:      small_interrupted_send,
  129:      interrupted_send,
  130:      exec_erlang_term,
  131:      exec_erlang_term_non_default_shell,
  132:      exec_disabled,
  133:      exec_shell_disabled,
  134:      start_shell,
  135:      new_shell_dumb_term,
  136:      new_shell_xterm_term,
  137:      start_shell_pty,
  138:      start_shell_exec,
  139:      start_shell_exec_fun,
  140:      start_shell_exec_fun2,
  141:      start_shell_exec_fun3,
  142:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun,
  143:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun2,
  144:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun3,
  145:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun_more_data,
  146:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error,
  147:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type,
  148:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write,
  149:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced,
  150:      start_shell_sock_exec_fun,
  151:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec,
  152:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi,
  153:      encode_decode_pty_opts,
  154:      connect_sock_not_tcp,
  155:      connect2_invalid_options,
  156:      connect_invalid_port,
  157:      connect_invalid_options,
  158:      connect_invalid_timeout_0,
  159:      connect_invalid_timeout_1,
  160:      connect3_invalid_port,
  161:      connect3_invalid_options,
  162:      connect3_invalid_timeout_0,
  163:      connect3_invalid_timeout_1,
  164:      connect3_invalid_both,
  165:      connect4_invalid_two_0,
  166:      connect4_invalid_two_1,
  167:      connect4_invalid_two_2,
  168:      connect4_invalid_three,
  169:      connect_timeout,
  170:      daemon_sock_not_tcp,
  171:      gracefull_invalid_version,
  172:      gracefull_invalid_start,
  173:      gracefull_invalid_long_start,
  174:      gracefull_invalid_long_start_no_nl,
  175:      kex_error,
  176:      stop_listener,
  177:      no_sensitive_leak,
  178:      start_subsystem_on_closed_channel,
  179:      max_channels_option
  180:     ].
  181: groups() ->
  182:     [{openssh, [], payload() ++ ptty() ++ sock()}].
  183: 
  184: payload() ->
  185:     [simple_exec,
  186:      simple_exec_more_data,
  187:      simple_exec_sock,
  188:      simple_exec_two_socks,
  189:      small_cat,
  190:      big_cat,
  191:      send_after_exit].
  192: 
  193: ptty() ->
  194:     [ptty_alloc_default,
  195:      ptty_alloc,
  196:      ptty_alloc_pixel].
  197: 
  198: sock() ->
  199:     [connect_sock_not_passive,
  200:      daemon_sock_not_passive
  201:     ].
  202: 
  203: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  204: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  205:     ?CHECK_CRYPTO(
  206:        [{ptty_supported, ssh_test_lib:ptty_supported()}
  207:         | Config]
  208:       ).
  209: 
  210: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  211:     catch ssh:stop(),
  212:     ok.
  213: 
  214: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  215: init_per_group(openssh, Config) ->
  216:     case ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []) of
  217: 	{error,econnrefused} ->
  218: 	    {skip,"No openssh daemon (econnrefused)"};
  219: 	{ok, Socket} ->
  220: 	    gen_tcp:close(Socket),
  221: 	    ssh_test_lib:openssh_sanity_check(Config)
  222:     end;
  223: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
  224:     Config.
  225: 
  226: end_per_group(_, Config) ->
  227:     Config.
  228: 
  229: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  230: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  231:     ssh:stop(),
  232:     ssh:start(),
  233:     {ok, TestLogHandlerRef} = ssh_test_lib:add_log_handler(),
  234:     ssh_test_lib:verify_sanity_check(Config),
  235:     [{log_handler_ref, TestLogHandlerRef} | Config].
  236: 
  237: end_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) ->
  238:     {ok, Events} = ssh_test_lib:get_log_events(
  239:                      proplists:get_value(log_handler_ref, Config)),
  240:     EventCnt = length(Events),
  241:     {ok, InterestingEventCnt} = analyze_events(Events, EventCnt),
  242:     VerificationResult = verify_events(TestCase, InterestingEventCnt),
  243:     ssh_test_lib:rm_log_handler(),
  244:     ssh:stop(),
  245:     VerificationResult.
  246: 
  247: analyze_events(_, 0) ->
  248:     {ok, 0};
  249: analyze_events(Events, EventNumber) when EventNumber > 0 ->
  250:     {ok, Cnt} = print_interesting_events(Events, 0),
  251:     case Cnt > 0 of
  252:         true ->
  253:             ct:comment("(logger stats) interesting: ~p boring: ~p",
  254:                        [Cnt, EventNumber - Cnt]);
  255:         _ ->
  256:             ct:comment("(logger stats) boring: ~p",
  257:                        [length(Events)])
  258:     end,
  259:     AllEventsSummary = lists:flatten([process_event(E) || E <- Events]),
  260:     ct:log("~nTotal logger events: ~p~nAll events:~n~s", [EventNumber, AllEventsSummary]),
  261:     {ok, Cnt}.
  262: 
  263: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  264:                         #{label := Label,
  265:                           report := [{supervisor, Supervisor},
  266:                                      {Status, Properties}]}},
  267:                 level := Level}) ->
  268:     format_event1(Label, Supervisor, Status, Properties, Level);
  269: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  270:                         #{label := Label,
  271:                           report := [{supervisor, Supervisor},
  272:                                      {errorContext, _ErrorContext},
  273:                                      {reason, {Status, _ReasonDetails}},
  274:                                      {offender, Properties}]}},
  275:                 level := Level}) ->
  276:     format_event1(Label, Supervisor, Status, Properties, Level);
  277: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  278:                         #{label := Label,
  279:                           report := [{supervisor, Supervisor},
  280:                                      {errorContext, _ErrorContext},
  281:                                      {reason, Status},
  282:                                      {offender, Properties}]}},
  283:                 level := Level}) ->
  284:     format_event1(Label, Supervisor, Status, Properties, Level);
  285: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  286:                         #{label := Label,
  287:                           report := [Properties, []]}},
  288:                 level := Level}) ->
  289:     {status, Status} = get_value(status, Properties),
  290:     {pid, Pid} = get_value(pid, Properties),
  291:     Id = get_value(registered_name, Properties),
  292:     {initial_call, {M, F, Args}} = get_value(initial_call, Properties),
  293:     io_lib:format("[~44s]  ~6s ~30s ~20s  ~30s ~20s:~10s(~40s)~n",
  294:                   [io_lib:format("~p", [E]) ||
  295:                       E <- [Pid, Level, Label, Status, Id, M, F, Args]]);
  296: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  297:                         #{label := Label,
  298:                           name := Pid,
  299:                           reason := {Reason, _Stack = [{M, F, Args, Location} | _]}}},
  300:                 level := Level}) ->
  301:     io_lib:format("[~44s]  ~6s ~30s ~20s  ~30s ~20s:~10s(~40s) ~30s~n",
  302:                   [io_lib:format("~p", [E]) ||
  303:                       E <- [Pid, Level, Label, Reason, undefined, M, F, Args, Location]]);
  304: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  305:                         #{label := Label,
  306:                          format := Format,
  307:                          args := Args}},
  308:                 meta := #{pid := Pid},
  309:                 level := Level}) ->
  310:     io_lib:format("[~44s]  ~6s ~30s ~150s~n",
  311:                   [io_lib:format("~p", [E]) ||
  312:                       E <- [Pid, Level, Label]] ++ [io_lib:format(Format, Args)]);
  313: process_event(E) ->
  314:     io_lib:format("~n||RAW event||~n~p~n", [E]).
  315: 
  316: format_event1(Label, Supervisor, Status, Properties, Level) ->
  317:     {pid, Pid} = get_value(pid, Properties),
  318:     Id = get_value(id, Properties),
  319:     {M, F, Args} = get_mfa_value(Properties),
  320:     RestartType = get_value(restart_type, Properties),
  321:     Significant = get_value(significant, Properties),
  322:     io_lib:format("[~30s <- ~10s]  ~6s ~30s ~20s  ~30s ~20s:~10s(~40s) ~20s ~25s~n",
  323:                   [io_lib:format("~p", [E]) ||
  324:                       E <- [Supervisor, Pid, Level, Label, Status, Id, M, F, Args,
  325:                             Significant, RestartType]]).
  326: 
  327: get_mfa_value(Properties) ->
  328:     case get_value(mfargs, Properties) of
  329:         {mfargs, MFA} ->
  330:             MFA;
  331:         false ->
  332:             {mfa, MFA} = get_value(mfa, Properties),
  333:             MFA
  334:     end.
  335: 
  336: get_value(Key, List) ->
  337:     case lists:keyfind(Key, 1, List) of
  338:         R = false ->
  339:             ct:log("Key ~p not found in~n~p", [Key, List]),
  340:             R;
  341:         R -> R
  342:     end.
  343: 
  344: print_interesting_events([], Cnt) ->
  345:     {ok, Cnt};
  346: print_interesting_events([#{level := Level} = Event | Tail], Cnt)
  347:   when Level /= info, Level /= notice ->
  348:     ct:log("------------~nInteresting event found:~n~p~n==========~n", [Event]),
  349:     print_interesting_events(Tail, Cnt + 1);
  350: print_interesting_events([_|Tail], Cnt) ->
  351:     print_interesting_events(Tail, Cnt).
  352: 
  353: verify_events(_TestCase, 0) -> ok;
  354: verify_events(no_sensitive_leak, 1) -> ok;
  355: verify_events(max_channels_option, 3) -> ok;
  356: verify_events(_TestCase, EventNumber) when EventNumber > 0->
  357:     {fail, lists:flatten(
  358:              io_lib:format("unexpected event cnt: ~s",
  359:                            [integer_to_list(EventNumber)]))}.
  360: 
  361: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  362: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  363: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  364: simple_exec(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  365:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  366:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  367: 
  368: simple_exec_more_data(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  369:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  370:     %% more data received, SSH window adjust needs to be sent by client
  371:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, 60000).
  372: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  373: simple_exec_sock(_Config) ->
  374:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  375:     {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  376:                                              {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  377:                                              {user_interaction, true}
  378:                                             ]),
  379:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  380: 
  381: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  382: simple_exec_two_socks(_Config) ->
  383:     Parent = self(),
  384:     F = fun() ->
  385:                 spawn_link(
  386:                   fun() ->
  387:                           {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  388:                           {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  389:                                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  390:                                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  391:                           Parent ! {self(),do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef)}
  392:                   end)
  393:         end,
  394:     Pid1 = F(),
  395:     Pid2 = F(),
  396:     receive
  397:         {Pid1,ok} -> ok
  398:     end,
  399:     receive
  400:         {Pid2,ok} -> ok
  401:     end.
  402: 
  403: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  404: connect2_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  405:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_socket, {bad, option}).
  406: 
  407: connect3_invalid_port(_Config) ->
  408:     {error, invalid_port} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, noport, [{key, value}]).
  409: 
  410: connect3_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  411:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, 1337, bad_options).
  412: 
  413: connect3_invalid_timeout_0(_Config) ->
  414:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  415:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], short).
  416: 
  417: connect3_invalid_timeout_1(_Config) ->
  418:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  419:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], -1).
  420: 
  421: connect3_invalid_both(_Config) ->
  422:     %% The actual reason is implementation dependent.
  423:     {error, _Reason} =
  424:         ssh:connect(bogus, no_list_or_port, no_list_or_timeout).
  425: 
  426: connect_invalid_port(Config) ->
  427:     {Pid, Host, _Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  428: 
  429:     {error, invalid_port} =
  430:         ssh:connect(Host, undefined,
  431:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  432:                      {user, "foo"},
  433:                      {password, "morot"},
  434:                      {user_interaction, false},
  435:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  436:                     infinity),
  437: 
  438:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  439: 
  440: connect_invalid_timeout_0(Config) ->
  441:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  442: 
  443:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  444:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  445:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  446:                      {user, "foo"},
  447:                      {password, "morot"},
  448:                      {user_interaction, false},
  449:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  450:                    longer),
  451: 
  452:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  453: 
  454: connect_invalid_timeout_1(Config) ->
  455:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  456: 
  457:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  458:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  459:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  460:                      {user, "foo"},
  461:                      {password, "morot"},
  462:                      {user_interaction, false},
  463:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  464:                    -1),
  465: 
  466:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  467: 
  468: connect_invalid_options(Config) ->
  469:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  470: 
  471:     {error, invalid_options} =
  472:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  473:                     {user, "foo"},
  474:                     infinity),
  475: 
  476:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  477: 
  478: %% Two out three arguments incorrect.  Three possibilities.
  479: connect4_invalid_two_0(Config) ->
  480:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  481: 
  482:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  483:     {error, _} =
  484:         ssh:connect(Host, noport,
  485:                     {user, "foo"},
  486:                     infinity),
  487: 
  488:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  489: 
  490: connect4_invalid_two_1(Config) ->
  491:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  492: 
  493:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  494:     {error, _} =
  495:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  496:                     {user, "foo"},
  497:                     short),
  498: 
  499:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  500: 
  501: connect4_invalid_two_2(Config) ->
  502:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  503: 
  504:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  505:     {error, _} =
  506:         ssh:connect(Host, newport,
  507:                     [{user, "foo"}],
  508:                     -1),
  509: 
  510:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  511: 
  512: %% All three args incorrect
  513: connect4_invalid_three(Config) ->
  514:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  515: 
  516:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  517:     {error, _} =
  518:         ssh:connect(Host, teleport,
  519:                     {user, "foo"},
  520:                     fortnight),
  521: 
  522:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  523: 
  524: daemon_start(Config) ->
  525:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  526:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  527:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  528:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  529: 
  530:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  531:                                              {user_dir, UserDir},
  532:                                              {password, "morot"},
  533:                                              {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
  534:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir}.
  535: 
  536: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  537: connect_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  538:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  539:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  540:                                                  {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  541:                                                  {user_interaction, true}]),
  542:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  543: 
  544: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  545: connect_timeout(_Config) ->
  546:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
  547:     {ok, {_,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),
  548:     {error,timeout} = ssh:connect(loopback, Port, [{connect_timeout,2000},
  549:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
  550:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true}]),
  551:     gen_tcp:close(Sl).
  552: 
  553: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  554: daemon_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  555:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  556:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  557:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  558: 
  559: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  560: connect_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  561:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  562:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  563:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  564:                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  565:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  566: 
  567: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  568: daemon_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  569:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  570:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  571:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  572: 
  573: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  574: small_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  575:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  576:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  577:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  578: 				  "cat", infinity),
  579: 
  580:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  581:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data),
  582:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  583: 
  584:     %% receive response to input
  585:     receive
  586: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, Data}} ->
  587: 	    ok
  588:     after 
  589: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  590:     end,
  591: 
  592:     %% receive close messages
  593:     receive
  594: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  595: 	    ok
  596:     after 
  597: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  598:     end,
  599:     receive
  600: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  601: 	    ok
  602:     after 
  603: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  604:     end,
  605:     receive
  606: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  607: 	    ok
  608:     after 
  609: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  610:     end.
  611: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  612: big_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  613:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  614: 							     {user_interaction, false}]),
  615:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  616:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  617: 				  "cat", infinity),
  618: 
  619:     %% build 10MB binary
  620:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,2500000)>>,
  621: 
  622:     ct:log("sending ~p byte binary~n",[size(Data)]),
  623:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 10000),
  624:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  625: 
  626:     %% collect echoed data until eof
  627:     case big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0) of
  628: 	{ok, Data} ->
  629: 	    ok;
  630: 	{ok, Other} ->
  631: 	    case size(Data) =:= size(Other) of
  632: 		true ->
  633: 		    ct:log("received and sent data are same"
  634: 			   "size but do not match~n",[]);
  635: 		false ->
  636: 		    ct:log("sent ~p but only received ~p~n",
  637: 			   [size(Data), size(Other)])
  638: 	    end,
  639: 	    ct:fail(receive_data_mismatch);
  640: 	Else ->
  641: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  642:     end,
  643: 
  644:     %% receive close messages (eof already consumed)
  645:     receive
  646: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  647: 	    ok 
  648:     after 
  649: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  650:     end,
  651:     receive
  652: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  653: 	    ok
  654:     after 
  655: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  656:     end.
  657: 
  658: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  659: send_after_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  660:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  661:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  662:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  663: 
  664:     %% Shell command "false" will exit immediately
  665:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  666: 				  "false", infinity),
  667:     receive
  668: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  669: 	    ok
  670:     after 
  671: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  672:     end,
  673:     receive
  674: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, ExitStatus}} when ExitStatus=/=0 ->
  675: 	    ok
  676:     after 
  677: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  678:     end,
  679:     receive
  680: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  681: 	    ok
  682:     after 
  683: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  684:     end,
  685:     case ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 2000) of
  686: 	{error, closed} -> ok;
  687: 	ok ->
  688: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, ok}});
  689: 	{error, timeout} ->
  690: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, {error, timeout}}});
  691: 	Else ->
  692: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  693:     end.
  694: 
  695: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  696: encode_decode_pty_opts(_Config) ->
  697:     Tags =
  698:         [vintr, vquit, verase, vkill, veof, veol, veol2, vstart, vstop, vsusp, vdsusp,
  699:          vreprint, vwerase, vlnext, vflush, vswtch, vstatus, vdiscard, ignpar, parmrk,
  700:          inpck, istrip, inlcr, igncr, icrnl, iuclc, ixon, ixany, ixoff, imaxbel, isig,
  701:          icanon, xcase, echo, echoe, echok, echonl, noflsh, tostop, iexten, echoctl,
  702:          echoke, pendin, opost, olcuc, onlcr, ocrnl, onocr, onlret, cs7, cs8, parenb,
  703:          parodd, tty_op_ispeed, tty_op_ospeed],
  704:     Opts =
  705:         lists:zip(Tags,
  706:                   lists:seq(1, length(Tags))),
  707:     
  708:     case ssh_connection:encode_pty_opts(Opts) of
  709:         Bin when is_binary(Bin) ->
  710:             case ssh_connection:decode_pty_opts(Bin) of
  711:                 Opts ->
  712:                     ok;
  713:                 Other ->
  714:                     ct:log("Expected ~p~nGot ~p~nBin = ~p",[Opts,Other,Bin]),
  715:                     ct:fail("Not the same",[])
  716:             end;
  717:         Other ->
  718:             ct:log("encode -> ~p",[Other]),
  719:             ct:fail("Encode failed",[])
  720:     end.
  721: 
  722: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  723: ptty_alloc_default(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  724:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  725:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  726:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  727:                  true -> success;
  728:                  false -> failure
  729:              end,
  730:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []),
  731:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  732: 
  733: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  734: ptty_alloc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  735:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  736:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  737:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  738:                  true -> success;
  739:                  false -> failure
  740:              end,
  741:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  742:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {width, 70}, {height, 20}]),
  743:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  744: 
  745: 
  746: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  747: ptty_alloc_pixel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  748:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  749:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  750:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  751:                  true -> success;
  752:                  false -> failure
  753:              end,
  754:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  755:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {pixel_widh, 630}, {pixel_hight, 470}]),
  756:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  757: 
  758: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  759: %%- small_interrupted_send is interrupted by ssh_echo_server which is
  760: %%  done with transferring data towards client and terminates the
  761: %%  channel (this results with {error, closed} return value from
  762: %%  ssh_connection:send on the client side)
  763: %%- interrupted_send used to be interrupted when ssh_echo_server ran
  764: %%  out of data window and closed channel
  765: %%- but with automatic window adjustment, above condition is not taking
  766: %%  place, so ssh_echo_server continues sending data until it is done
  767: %%- so ssh_connection:send returns 'ok'
  768: small_interrupted_send(Config) ->
  769:     K = 1024,
  770:     SendSize = 10 * K * K,
  771:     EchoSize = 4 * K,
  772:     do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, {error, closed}).
  773: interrupted_send(Config) ->
  774:     K = 1024,
  775:     SendSize = 10 * K * K,
  776:     EchoSize = 4 * K * K,
  777:     do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, ok).
  778: 
  779: do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, SenderResult) ->
  780:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  781:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  782:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  783:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  784:     EchoSS_spec = {ssh_echo_server, [EchoSize,[{dbg,true}]]},
  785:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  786: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  787: 					     {password, "morot"},
  788: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n",EchoSS_spec}]}]),
  789:     ct:log("~p:~p connect", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  790:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  791: 						      {user, "foo"},
  792: 						      {password, "morot"},
  793: 						      {user_interaction, false},
  794: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  795:     ct:log("~p:~p connected", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  796:     %% build big binary
  797:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,SendSize div 4)>>,
  798:     %% expect remote end to send us EchoSize back
  799:     <<ExpectedData:EchoSize/binary, _/binary>> = Data,
  800:     %% Spawn listener. Otherwise we could get a deadlock due to filled buffers
  801:     Parent = self(),
  802:     ResultPid = spawn(
  803: 		  fun() ->
  804: 			  ct:log("~p:~p open channel",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  805: 			  {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  806: 			  ct:log("~p:~p start subsystem", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  807: 			  case ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "echo_n", infinity) of
  808: 			      success ->
  809: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, ChannelId},
  810: 				  Result =
  811: 				      try collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize)
  812: 				      of
  813: 					  ExpectedData ->
  814: 					      ct:log("~p:~p got expected data",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  815: 					      ok;
  816: 					  Other ->
  817: 					      ct:log("~p:~p unexpected: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  818: 					      {fail,"unexpected result in listener"}
  819: 				      catch
  820: 					  Class:Exception ->
  821: 					      {fail, io_lib:format("Listener exception ~p:~p",[Class,Exception])}
  822: 				      end,
  823: 				  Parent ! {self(), result, Result};
  824: 			      Other ->
  825: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, error, Other}
  826: 			  end
  827: 		  end),
  828:     receive
  829: 	{ResultPid, channelId, error, Other} ->
  830: 	    ct:log("~p:~p channelId error ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  831: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  832: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  833: 	    {fail, "ssh_connection:subsystem"};
  834: 	{ResultPid, channelId, ChannelId} ->
  835: 	    ct:log("~p:~p ~p going to send ~p bytes", [?MODULE,?LINE,self(),size(Data)]),
  836: 	    SenderPid = spawn(fun() ->
  837: 				      Parent ! {self(),  ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Data, 30000)}
  838: 			      end),
  839: 	    receive
  840: 	    	{ResultPid, result, {fail, Fail}} ->
  841: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Listener failed: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Fail]),
  842: 		    {fail, Fail};
  843: 		{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  844: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  845: 		    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  846: 		    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  847: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Check sender", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  848: 		    receive
  849: 			{SenderPid, SenderResult} ->
  850: 			    ct:log("~p:~p ~p - That's what we expect :)",
  851:                                    [?MODULE,?LINE, SenderResult]),
  852: 			    ok;
  853: 			Msg ->
  854: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Not expected send result: ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  855: 			    {fail, "Not expected msg"}
  856: 		    end;
  857: 		{SenderPid, SenderResult} ->
  858: 		    ct:log("~p:~p ~p - That's what we expect, "
  859:                            "but client channel handler has not reported yet",
  860:                            [?MODULE,?LINE, SenderResult]),
  861: 		    receive
  862: 			{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  863: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Now got the result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  864: 			    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  865: 			    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  866: 			    ok;
  867: 			Msg ->
  868: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Got an unexpected msg ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  869: 			    {fail, "Un-expected msg"}
  870: 		    end;
  871: 		Msg ->
  872: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  873: 		    {fail, "Unexpected msg"}
  874: 	    end
  875:     end.
  876: 
  877: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  878: start_shell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  879:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  880:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  881:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  882:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  883:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  884: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  885: 					     {password, "morot"},
  886: 					     {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end} ]),
  887: 
  888:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  889: 						      {user, "foo"},
  890: 						      {password, "morot"},
  891: 						      {user_interaction, true},
  892: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  893:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Enter command">>), % No pty alloc by erl client
  894:     test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef),
  895:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  896:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  897: 
  898: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  899: new_shell_dumb_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  900:     new_shell_helper(#{term => "dumb",
  901:                        cmds => ["one_atom_please.\n",
  902:                                 "\^R" % attempt to trigger history search
  903:                                ],
  904:                        exp_output =>
  905:                            [<<"Enter command\r\n">>,
  906:                             <<"1> ">>,
  907:                             <<"one_atom_please.\r\n">>,
  908:                             <<"{simple_eval,one_atom_please}\r\n">>,
  909:                             <<"2> ">>],
  910:                        unexp_output =>
  911:                            [<<"\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m ">>]},
  912:                     Config).
  913: 
  914: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  915: new_shell_xterm_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  916:     new_shell_helper(#{term => "xterm",
  917:                        cmds => ["one_atom_please.\n",
  918:                                 "\^R" % attempt to trigger history search
  919:                                ],
  920:                        exp_output =>
  921:                            [<<"Enter command\r\n">>,
  922:                             <<"1> ">>,
  923:                             <<"one_atom_please.\r\n\e[1022D\e[1B">>,
  924:                             <<"{simple_eval,one_atom_please}\r\n">>,
  925:                             <<"2> ">>,
  926:                             <<"\e[3D\e[J">>,
  927:                             <<"\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m ">>,
  928:                             <<"\r\n  one_atom_please.">>]},
  929:                     Config).
  930: 
  931: new_shell_helper(#{term := Term, cmds := Cmds,
  932:                    exp_output := ExpectedOutput} = Settings, Config) ->
  933:     UnexpectedOutput = maps:get(unexp_output, Settings, []),
  934:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  935:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  936:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  937:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  938:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  939: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  940: 					     {password, "morot"},
  941:                                              {subsystems, []},
  942:                                              {keepalive, true},
  943:                                              {nodelay, true},
  944:                                              {shell, fun(U, H) ->
  945:                                                              start_our_shell2(U, H)
  946:                                                      end}
  947:                                             ]),
  948:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  949: 						      {user, "foo"},
  950: 						      {password, "morot"},
  951: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  952:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  953:     success =
  954:         ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId,
  955:                                   [{term, Term}, {hight, 24}, {width,1023}],
  956:                                   infinity),
  957:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
  958:     [ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, C) || C <- Cmds],
  959:     GetTuple = fun(Bin) -> {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,0,Bin}} end,
  960:     Msgs = [GetTuple(B) || B <- ExpectedOutput],
  961:     expected = ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result(Msgs),
  962:     UnexpectedMsgs = [GetTuple(C) || C <- UnexpectedOutput],
  963:     flush_msgs(UnexpectedMsgs),
  964: 
  965:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  966:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  967: 
  968: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------
  969: start_shell_pty(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  970:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  971:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  972:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  973:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  974:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  975: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  976: 					     {password, "morot"},
  977: 					     {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end} ]),
  978: 
  979:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  980: 						      {user, "foo"},
  981: 						      {password, "morot"},
  982: 						      {user_interaction, true},
  983: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),

  985:     test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef),
  986:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),

 1000: 
 1001:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1002: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1003: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1004: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1005: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1006:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef),
 1007:     test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef,  "testing",  <<"echo testing\r\n">>),
 1008:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1009:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).

 1011: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1012: exec_erlang_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1013:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1014:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1015:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1016:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1017:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1018: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1019: 					     {password, "morot"}
 1020:                                             ]),
 1021: 
 1022:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1023: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1024: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1025: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1026: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1027:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef),
 1028:     test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef),
 1029:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1030:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1031: 
 1032: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1033: exec_erlang_term_non_default_shell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1034:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1035:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1036:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1037:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1038:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1039: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1040: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1041:                                              {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end}
 1042:                                             ]),
 1043: 
 1044:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1045: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1046: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1047: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1048: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}
 1049:                                                      ]),
 1050:     test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef),
 1051:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1052:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).

 1064:                                             ]),

 1079:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1080:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1081:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1082: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1083: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1084:                                              {shell, disabled}
 1085:                                             ]),

 1087: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1088: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1089: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1090: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}
 1091:                                                      ]),

 1096: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1097: start_shell_exec_fun(Config) ->
 1098:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd) ->
 1099:                                     spawn(fun() ->
 1100:                                                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
 1101:                                           end)
 1102:                             end,
 1103:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\n">>, 0,
 1104:                             Config).
 1105: 
 1106: start_shell_exec_fun2(Config) ->
 1107:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User) ->
 1108:                                     spawn(fun() ->
 1109:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 1110:                                           end)
 1111:                             end,
 1112:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\n">>, 0,
 1113:                             Config).
 1114: 
 1115: start_shell_exec_fun3(Config) ->
 1116:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User, _PeerAddr) ->
 1117:                                     spawn(fun() ->
 1118:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 1119:                                           end)
 1120:                             end,
 1121:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\n">>, 0,
 1122:                             Config).
 1123: 
 1124: start_shell_exec_direct_fun(Config) ->
 1125:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s~n",[Cmd])} end},
 1126:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\n">>, 0,
 1127:                             Config).
 1128: 
 1129: start_shell_exec_direct_fun2(Config) ->
 1130:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
 1131:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
 1132:                             Config).
 1133: 
 1134: start_shell_exec_direct_fun3(Config) ->
 1135:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User,_PeerAddr) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
 1136:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
 1137:                             Config).
 1138: 
 1139: start_shell_exec_direct_fun_more_data(Config) ->
 1140:     N = 60000,
 1141:     ExpectedBin = <<"testing\n">>,
 1142:     ReceiveFun =
 1143:         fun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, _Expect, _ExpectType) ->
 1144:                 receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId,
 1145:                               N * byte_size(ExpectedBin), 0)
 1146:         end,
 1147:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct,
 1148:                              fun(_Cmd) ->
 1149:                                      {ok,
 1150:                                       [io_lib:format("testing~n",[]) ||
 1151:                                           _ <- lists:seq(1, N)]}
 1152:                              end},
 1153:                             "not_relevant", <<"not_used\n">>, 0,
 1154:                             ReceiveFun,
 1155:                             Config).
 1156: 
 1157: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error(Config) ->
 1158:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> {error, {bad}} end},
 1159:                             "testing", <<"**Error** {bad}">>, 1,
 1160:                             Config).
 1161: 
 1162: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type(Config) ->
 1163:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> very_bad end},
 1164:                             "testing", <<"**Error** Bad exec fun in server. Invalid return value: very_bad">>, 1,
 1165:                             Config).
 1166: 
 1167: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write(Config) ->
 1168:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1169:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1170:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1171:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1172:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1173: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1174: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1175: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1176: 
 1177:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1178:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1179:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1180:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1181:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1182: 
 1183:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1184: 
 1185:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1186:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\n">>}}),
 1187: 
 1188:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1189:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1190:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\n">>}}),
 1191: 
 1192:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1193:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "quit.\n", 5000),
 1194:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{1,inputs}">>}}),
 1195:     receive
 1196:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,0}} -> ok
 1197:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1198:     end,
 1199:     receive
 1200:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1201:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1202:     end,
 1203:     receive
 1204:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1205:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1206:     end,
 1207:     receive
 1208:         X -> ct:fail("remaining messages"),
 1209:              ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X])
 1210:     after 0 -> go_on
 1211:     end,
 1212:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1213: 
 1214: 
 1215: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced(Config) ->
 1216:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1217:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1218:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1219:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1220:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1221: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1222: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1223: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1224: 
 1225:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1226:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1227:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1228:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1229:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1230: 
 1231:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1232: 
 1233:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1234:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\n">>}}),
 1235: 
 1236:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1237:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1238:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\n">>}}),
 1239: 
 1240:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1241:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'Hi ", 5000),
 1242:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "there", 5000),
 1243:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'", 5000),
 1244:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, ".\n", 5000),
 1245:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,'Hi there'}\n">>}}),
 1246:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"3> ">>}}),
 1247:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "bad_input.\n", 5000),
 1248:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,1,<<"**Error** {bad_input,3}">>}}),
 1249:     receive
 1250:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,255}} -> ok
 1251:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1252:     end,
 1253:     receive
 1254:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1255:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1256:     end,
 1257:     receive
 1258:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1259:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1260:     end,
 1261:     receive
 1262:         X -> ct:fail("remaining messages"),
 1263:              ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X])
 1264:     after 0 -> go_on
 1265:     end,
 1266:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1267: 
 1268: 
 1269: 
 1270:     
 1271: %% A tiny read-write loop ended by a 'quit.\n'
 1272: read_write_loop(Prompt) ->
 1273:     io:format("Tiny read/write test~n", []),
 1274:     read_write_loop1(Prompt, 1).
 1275: 
 1276: read_write_loop1(Prompt, N) ->
 1277:     case io:read(lists:concat([N,Prompt])) of
 1278:         {ok, quit} ->
 1279:             {ok, {N-1, inputs}};
 1280:         {ok, bad_input} ->
 1281:             {error, {bad_input,N}};
 1282:         {ok,Inp} ->
 1283:             io:format("~p~n",[simple_eval(Inp)]),
 1284:             read_write_loop1(Prompt, N+1)
 1285:     end.
 1286:     
 1287: simple_eval(Inp) -> {simple_eval,Inp}.
 1288: 
 1289: 
 1290: do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, Config) ->
 1291:     DefaultReceiveFun =
 1292:         fun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Expect, ExpectType) ->
 1293:                 receive
 1294:                     {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, ExpectType, Expect}} ->
 1295:                         ok
 1296:                 after 5000 ->
 1297:                         receive
 1298:                             Other ->
 1299:                                 ct:log("Received other:~n~p~nExpected: ~p~n",
 1300:                                        [Other,
 1301:                                         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,
 1302:                                          {data, ChannelId, ExpectType, Expect}}]),
 1303:                                          %% {data, '_ChannelId', ExpectType, Expect}}]),
 1304:                                 ct:fail("Unexpected response")
 1305:                         after 0 ->
 1306:                                 ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1307:                         end
 1308:                 end
 1309:         end,
 1310:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, DefaultReceiveFun, Config).
 1311: 
 1312: do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, ReceiveFun, Config) ->
 1313:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1314:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1315:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1316:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1317:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1318: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1319: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1320: 					     {exec, Fun}]),
 1321: 
 1322:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1323: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1324: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1325: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1326: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1327: 
 1328:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1329:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Command, infinity),
 1330:     ReceiveFun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Expect, ExpectType),
 1331:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1332:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1333: 
 1334: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1335: start_shell_sock_exec_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1336:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1337:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1338:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1339:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1340:     {Pid, HostD, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1341:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1342:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1343:                                               {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1344:     Host = ssh_test_lib:ntoa(ssh_test_lib:mangle_connect_address(HostD)),
 1345: 
 1346:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, [{active,false}]),
 1347:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1348:                                             {save_accepted_host, false},
 1349: 					    {user, "foo"},
 1350: 					    {password, "morot"},
 1351: 					    {user_interaction, true},
 1352: 					    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1353: 
 1354:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1355: 
 1356:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1357: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1358: 
 1359:     receive
 1360: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1361: 	    ok
 1362:     after 5000 ->
 1363: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1364:     end,
 1365: 
 1366:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1367:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1368: 
 1369: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1370: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec(Config) ->
 1371:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1372:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1373:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1374:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1375: 
 1376:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1377:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1378:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1379: 
 1380:     %% A server tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1381:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1382: 		       {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1383: 		       {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1384: 						    {user_dir, UserDir},
 1385: 						    {password, "morot"},
 1386: 						    {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}])
 1387: 	       end),
 1388: 
 1389:     %% The client accepts the tcp connection from the server and ssh-connects to it
 1390:     {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1391:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1392:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1393: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1394: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1395: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1396: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1397: 
 1398:     %% And runs some commands
 1399:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1400: 
 1401:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1402: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1403: 
 1404:     receive
 1405: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1406: 	    ok
 1407:     after 5000 ->
 1408: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1409:     end,
 1410: 
 1411:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
 1412: 
 1413: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1414: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi(Config) ->
 1415:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1416:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1417:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1418:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1419: 
 1420:     NumConcurent = 5,
 1421: 
 1422:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1423:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1424:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1425: 
 1426:     DaemonOpts = [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1427:                   {user_dir, UserDir},
 1428:                   {password, "morot"},
 1429:                   {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}],
 1430: 
 1431:     %% Servers tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1432:     Pids =
 1433:         [spawn_link(fun() ->
 1434:                             {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1435:                             {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, DaemonOpts)
 1436:                     end)
 1437:          || _ <- lists:seq(1,NumConcurent)],
 1438:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p daemons spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(Pids)]),
 1439: 
 1440:     %% The client accepts the tcp connections from the servers and ssh-connects to it
 1441:     ConnectionRefs =
 1442:         [begin
 1443:              {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1444:              {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1445:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
 1446:                                                    {user, "foo"},
 1447:                                                    {password, "morot"},
 1448:                                                    {user_interaction, true},
 1449:                                                    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1450:              ConnectionRef
 1451:          end || _Pid <- Pids],
 1452:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p connections accepted!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ConnectionRefs)]),
 1453: 
 1454:     %% And runs some exec commands
 1455:     Parent = self(),
 1456:     ClientPids =
 1457:         lists:map(
 1458:           fun(ConnectionRef) ->
 1459:                   spawn_link(
 1460:                     fun() ->
 1461:                             {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1462:                             success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "testing", infinity),
 1463:                             ct:log("~p:~p: exec on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef]),
 1464:                             receive
 1465:                                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1466:                                     Parent ! {answer_received,self()},
 1467:                                     ct:log("~p:~p: received result on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef])
 1468:                             after 5000 ->
 1469:                                     ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1470:                             end
 1471:                     end)
 1472:           end, ConnectionRefs),
 1473:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p clients spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ClientPids)]),
 1474: 
 1475:     lists:foreach(fun(P) ->
 1476:                           receive
 1477:                               {answer_received,P} -> ok
 1478:                           end
 1479:                   end, ClientPids),
 1480:     ct:log("~p:~p: All answers received!", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
 1481: 
 1482:     lists:foreach(fun ssh:close/1, ConnectionRefs).
 1483: 
 1484: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1485: gracefull_invalid_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1486:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1487:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1488:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1489:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1490:     
 1491:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1492:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1493:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1494: 
 1495:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1496:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S,  ["SSH-8.-1","\r\n"]),
 1497:     receive
 1498: 	Verstring ->
 1499: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1500: 	    receive
 1501: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1502: 		    ok
 1503: 	    end
 1504:     after 
 1505: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1506:     end.
 1507: 
 1508: gracefull_invalid_start(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1509:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1510:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1511:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1512:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1513:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1514:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1515:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1516: 
 1517:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1518:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S,  ["foobar","\r\n"]),
 1519:     receive
 1520: 	Verstring ->
 1521: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1522: 	    receive
 1523: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1524: 		    ok
 1525: 	    end
 1526:     after 
 1527: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1528:     end.
 1529: 
 1530: gracefull_invalid_long_start(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1531:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1532:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1533:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1534:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1535:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1536:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1537:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1538: 
 1539:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1540:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S, [lists:duplicate(257, $a), "\r\n"]),
 1541:     receive
 1542: 	Verstring ->
 1543: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1544: 	    receive
 1545: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1546: 		    ok
 1547: 	    end
 1548:     after 
 1549: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1550:     end.

 1553: gracefull_invalid_long_start_no_nl(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1554:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1555:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1556:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1557:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1558:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1559:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1560:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1561: 
 1562:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1563:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S, [lists:duplicate(257, $a), "\r\n"]),
 1564:     receive
 1565: 	Verstring ->
 1566: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1567: 	    receive
 1568: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1569: 		    ok
 1570: 	    end
