 1575: kex_error(Config) ->
 1576:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1577:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1578:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1579:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1580:     [Kex1,Kex2|_] = proplists:get_value(kex, ssh:default_algorithms()),
 1581:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1582:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1583:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1584:                                               {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex1]}]}
 1585:                                              ]),
 1586:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1587:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(kex_error,
 1588:                            fun(#{msg:={report,#{format:=Fmt,args:=As,label:={error_logger,_}}}}, Pid) ->
 1589:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1590:                                    Pid ! {Ref, lists:flatten(io_lib:format(Fmt,As))};
 1591:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1592:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1593:                                    ok % Other msg
 1594:                            end,
 1595:                            self()),
 1596:     try
 1597:         ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1598:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1599:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1600:                                           {user_interaction, false},
 1601:                                           {user_dir, UserDir},
 1602:                                           {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex2]}]}
 1603:                                          ])
 1604:     of
 1605:         _ ->
 1606:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1607:             ct:fail("expected failure", [])
 1608:     catch
 1609:         error:{badmatch,{error,"Key exchange failed"}} ->
 1610:             %% ok
 1611:             receive
 1612:                 {Ref, ErrMsgTxt} ->
 1613:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1614:                     ct:log("ErrMsgTxt = ~n~s", [ErrMsgTxt]),
 1615:                     Lines = lists:map(fun string:trim/1, string:tokens(ErrMsgTxt, "\n")),
 1616:                     OK = (lists:all(fun(S) -> lists:member(S,Lines) end,
 1617:                                     ["Disconnects with code = 3 [RFC4253 11.1]: Key exchange failed",
 1618:                                      "Details:",
 1619:                                      "No common key exchange algorithm,",
 1620:                                      "we have:",
 1621:                                      "peer have:"]) andalso
 1622:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex1)) =/= nomatch andalso
 1623:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex2)) =/= nomatch),
 1624:                     case OK of
 1625:                         true ->
 1626:                             ok;
 1627:                         false ->
 1628:                             ct:fail("unexpected error text msg", [])
 1629:                     end
 1630:             after 20000 ->
 1631:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1632:                     ct:fail("timeout", [])
 1633:             end;
 1634: 
 1635:         error:{badmatch,{error,_}} ->
 1636:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1637:             ct:fail("unexpected error msg", [])
 1638:     end.
 1639: 
 1640: stop_listener(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1641:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1642:     %% to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1643:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1644:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1645:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1646: 
 1647:     {Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1648: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1649: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1650: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1651: 
 1652:     ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port,
 1653:                                           [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1654:                                            {user, "foo"},
 1655:                                            {password, "morot"},
 1656:                                            {user_interaction, false},
 1657:                                            {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1658:     {ok, ChannelId0} =
 1659:         ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef0, infinity),
 1660: 
 1661:     ssh:stop_listener(Host, Port),
 1662: 
 1663:     {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1664:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1665:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1666: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1667: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1668: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1669: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1670:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef0, ChannelId0,
 1671: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1672:     receive
 1673: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef0,
 1674:          {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1675: 	    ok
 1676:     after 5000 ->
 1677: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1678:     end,
 1679: 
 1680:     case ssh_test_lib:daemon(Port, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1681:                                     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1682:                                     {password, "potatis"},
 1683:                                     {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]) of
 1684: 	{Pid1, Host, Port} ->
 1685: 	    ConnectionRef1 =
 1686:                 ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1687:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1688:                                                   {password, "potatis"},
 1689:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1690:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1691: 	    {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1692:                                                   {save_accepted_host, false},
 1693:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1694:                                                   {password, "morot"},
 1695:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1696:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1697: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1698: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef1),
 1699: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1700: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid1);
 1701: 	Error ->
 1702: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1703: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1704: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, Error})
 1705:     end.
 1706: 
 1707: no_sensitive_leak(Config) ->
 1708:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1709:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1710:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1711:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1712: 
 1713:     %% Save old, and set new log level:
 1714:     #{level := Level} = logger:get_primary_config(),
 1715:     logger:set_primary_config(level, info),
 1716:     %% Define a collect fun:
 1717:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1718:     Collect = 
 1719:         fun G(N,Nf,Nt) ->
 1720:                 receive
 1721:                     {Ref, false, _} ->
 1722:                         G(N+1, Nf+1, Nt);
 1723:                     {Ref, true, R} ->
 1724:                         ct:log("Report leaked:~n~p", [R]),
 1725:                         G(N+1, Nf, Nt+1)
 1726:                 after 100 ->
 1727:                         {N, Nf, Nt}
 1728:                 end
 1729:         end,
 1730:  
 1731:     %% Install the test handler:
 1732:     Hname = no_sensitive_leak,
 1733:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(Hname,
 1734:                            fun(#{msg := {report,#{report := Rep}}}, Pid) ->
 1735:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1736:                                    Pid ! {Ref,ssh_log_h:sensitive_in_opt(Rep),Rep};
 1737:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1738:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1739:                                    ok
 1740:                            end,
 1741:                            self()),
 1742: 
 1743:     {_Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1744: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1745: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1746: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1747: 
 1748:     _ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1749: 						       {user, "foo"},
 1750: 						       {password, "morot"},
 1751: 						       {user_interaction, true},
 1752: 						       {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1753:     %% Kill acceptor to make it restart:
 1754:     [true|_] =
 1755:         [exit(Pacc,kill) || {{ssh_system_sup,_},P1,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(sshd_sup),
 1756:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},P2,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P1),
 1757:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},Pacc,worker,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P2)],
 1758:     
 1759:     %% Remove the test handler and reset the logger level:
 1760:     timer:sleep(500),
 1761:     logger:remove_handler(Hname),
 1762:     logger:set_primary_config(Level),
 1763: 
 1764:     case Collect(0, 0, 0) of
 1765:         {0, 0,   0} -> ct:fail("Logging failed, line = ~p", [?LINE]);
 1766:         {_, _,   0} -> ok;
 1767:         {_, _, Nt0} -> ct:fail("Leak in ~p cases!", [Nt0])
 1768:     end.
 1769:     
 1770: start_subsystem_on_closed_channel(Config) ->
 1771:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1772:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1773:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1774:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1775:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1776: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1777: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1778: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}]),
 1779: 
 1780:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1781: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1782: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1783: 						      {user_interaction, false},
 1784: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1785: 
 1786: 
 1787:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1788:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1),
 1789:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, []),
 1790:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", 5000),
 1791:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1792:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1793: 
 1794:     %% Test that there could be a gap between close and an operation (Bugfix OTP-14939):
 1795:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1796:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2),
 1797:     timer:sleep(2000),
 1798:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, []),
 1799:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "echo_n", 5000),
 1800:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1801:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1802: 
 1803:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1804:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1805: 
 1806: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1807: max_channels_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1808:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1809:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1810:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1811:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1812:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1813: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1814: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1815: 					     {max_channels, 3},
 1816: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}
 1817: 					    ]),
 1818: 
 1819:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1820: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1821: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1822: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1823: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1824: 
 1825:     %% Allocate a number of ChannelId:s to play with. (This operation is not
 1826:     %% counted by the max_channel option).
 1827:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1828:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1829:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1830:     {ok, ChannelId3} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1831:     {ok, ChannelId4} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1832:     {ok, ChannelId5} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1833:     {ok, ChannelId6} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1834:     {ok, _ChannelId7} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1835: 
 1836:     %% Now start to open the channels (this is counted my max_channels) to check that
 1837:     %% it gives a failure at right place
 1838: 
 1839:     %%%---- Channel 1(3): shell
 1840:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId0),
 1841:     receive
 1842: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"Eshell",_/binary>>}} ->
 1843: 	    ok
 1844:     after 5000 ->
 1845: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 1846:     end,
 1847: 
 1848:     %%%---- Channel 2(3): subsystem "echo_n"
 1849:     success = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", infinity),
 1850: 
 1851:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): exec. This closes itself.
 1852:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", infinity),
 1853:     receive
 1854: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId2, 0, <<"testing1",_/binary>>}} ->
 1855: 	    ok
 1856:     after 5000 ->
 1857: 	    ct:fail("Exec #1 Timeout")
 1858:     end,
 1859: 
 1860:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): subsystem "echo_n" (Note that ChannelId2 should be closed now)
 1861:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId3, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1862: 
 1863:     %%%---- Channel 4(3) !: exec  This should fail
 1864:     failure = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId4, "testing2.\n", infinity),
 1865: 
 1866:     %%%---- close the shell (Frees one channel)
 1867:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1868:     
 1869:     %%%---- wait for the subsystem to terminate
 1870:     receive
 1871: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef,{closed,ChannelId0}} -> ok
 1872:     after 5000 ->
 1873: 	    ct:log("Timeout waiting for '{ssh_cm,~p,{closed,~p}}'~n"
 1874: 		   "Message queue:~n~p",
 1875: 		   [ConnectionRef,ChannelId0,erlang:process_info(self(),messages)]),
 1876: 	    ct:fail("exit Timeout",[])
 1877:     end,
 1878: 
 1879:     %%---- Try that we can open one channel instead of the closed one
 1880:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId5, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1881: 
 1882:     %%---- But not a fourth one...
 1883:     failure = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId6, "echo_n", infinity),
 1884: 
 1885:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1886:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1887: 
 1888: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1889: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
 1890: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1891: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef) ->
 1892:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, 1).
 1893: 
 1894: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, N) ->
 1895:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1896:     Cmd = "yes testing | head -n " ++ integer_to_list(N),
 1897:     ct:log("Cmd to be invoked over SSH shell: ~p", [Cmd]),
 1898:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Cmd, infinity),
 1899:     ExpectedBin = <<"testing\n">>,
 1900:     case N of
 1901:         1 ->
 1902:             %% receive response to input
 1903:             receive
 1904:                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, ExpectedBin}} ->
 1905:                     ok
 1906:             after
 1907:                 10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1908:             end;
 1909:         _ ->
 1910:             receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, N * byte_size(ExpectedBin), 0)
 1911:     end,
 1912: 
 1913:     %% receive close messages
 1914:     receive
 1915: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
 1916: 	    ok
 1917:     after
 1918: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1919:     end,
 1920:     receive
 1921: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
 1922: 	    ok
 1923:     after
 1924: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1925:     end,
 1926:     receive
 1927: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
 1928: 	    ok
 1929:     after
 1930: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1931:     end.
 1932: 
 1933: 
 1934: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1935: flush_msgs() ->
 1936:     flush_msgs([]).
 1937: 
 1938: flush_msgs(Unexpected) ->
 1939:     receive
 1940:         M ->
 1941:             case lists:member(M, Unexpected) of
 1942:                 true ->
 1943:                     ct:fail("Unexpected message found:  ~p", [M]);
 1944:                 _ ->
 1945:                     flush_msgs()
 1946:             end
 1947:     after
 1948:         500 -> ok
 1949:     end.
 1950: 
 1951: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1952: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1953:     test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Prohibited.">>, <<"Eshell V">>).
 1954: 
 1955: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, NotExpect) ->
 1956:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1957:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef, ChannelId),
 1958:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1959:     NotExpSz = size(NotExpect),
 1960:     receive
 1961:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 1, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1962:             flush_msgs();
 1963: 
 1964:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<NotExpect:NotExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1965:             ct:fail("Could start disabled shell!");
 1966: 
 1967:         R ->
 1968:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1969:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, '0|1', Expect}} ]),
 1970:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 1971: 
 1972:     after 5000 ->
 1973:             ct:fail("Shell Timeout")
 1974:     end.
 1975: 
 1976: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1977: test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1978:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1979:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "1+2.", infinity),
 1980:     receive
 1981:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ->
 1982:             flush_msgs();
 1983:         R ->
 1984:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1985:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ]),
 1986:             ct:fail("Could exec erlang term although non-erlang shell")
 1987:     after 5000 ->
 1988:             ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1989:     end.
 1990: 
 1991: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1992: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1993:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Eshell V">>).
 1994: 
 1995: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect) ->
 1996:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, []).
 1997: 
 1998: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, PtyOpts) ->
 1999:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2000:     case PtyOpts of
 2001:         [] ->
 2002:             no_alloc;
 2003:         _ ->
 2004:             success = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, PtyOpts)
 2005:     end,
 2006:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
 2007: 
 2008:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 2009:     receive
 2010: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 2011: 	    flush_msgs();
 2012: 
 2013:         R ->
 2014:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 2015:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}} ]),
 2016:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 2017: 
 2018:     after 5000 ->
 2019: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 2020:     end.
 2021: 
 2022: 
 2023: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 2024:     test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, "1+2.", <<"3">>).
 2025: 
 2026: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Exec, Expect) ->
 2027:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2028:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Exec, infinity),
 2029:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 2030:     receive
 2031:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0,
 2032:                                  <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} = R ->
 2033:             ct:log("~p:~p Got expected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,R]);
 2034:         Other ->
 2035:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 2036:                    [?MODULE,?LINE, Other, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,
 2037:                                            {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}}]),
 2038:             {fail, "Unexpected data"}
 2039:     after 5000 ->
 2040:             {fail,"Exec Timeout"}
 2041:     end.
 2042: 
 2043: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 2044: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId) ->
 2045:     big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []).
 2046: 
 2047: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Acc) ->
 2048:     receive
 2049: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} ->
 2050: 	    big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, [Data | Acc]);
 2051: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId}} ->
 2052: 	    {ok, iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))}
 2053:     after ?EXEC_TIMEOUT ->
 2054: 	    timeout
 2055:     end.
 2056: 
 2057: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize) ->
 2058:     ct:log("~p:~p Listener ~p running! ConnectionRef=~p, ChannelId=~p",
 2059:            [?MODULE,?LINE,self(),ConnectionRef,ChannelId]),
 2060:     collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [], 0).
 2061: 
 2062: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum) ->
 2063:     TO = 5000,
 2064:     receive
 2065: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} when is_binary(Data) ->
 2066: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p bytes. total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 2067: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,size(Data),Sum+size(Data),EchoSize-Sum]),
 2068: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [Data | Acc], Sum+size(Data));
 2069: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={eof, ChannelId}} ->
 2070: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 2071: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={closed,ChannelId}} ->
 2072: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 2073: 	Msg ->
 2074: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ***** unexpected message *****~n~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
 2075: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 2076:     after TO ->
 2077: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ----- Nothing received for ~p seconds -----~n",[?MODULE,?LINE,TO]),
 2078: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 2079:     end.
 2080: 
 2081: collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize) ->
 2082:     try
 2083: 	iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))
 2084:     of
 2085: 	Bin ->
 2086: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nGot in total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 2087: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,size(Bin),EchoSize,size(Bin)]),
 2088: 	    Bin
 2089:     catch
 2090: 	C:E ->
 2091: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nAcc is strange...~nException=~p:~p~nAcc=~p",
 2092: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,C,E,Acc]),
 2093: 	    {error,{C,E}}
 2094:     end.
 2095: 
 2096: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
 2097: %% This is taken from the ssh example code.
 2098: start_our_shell(_User, _Peer) ->
 2099:     spawn(fun() ->
 2100: 		  io:format("Enter command\n")
 2101: 		  %% Don't actually loop, just exit
 2102:           end).
 2103: 
 2104: start_our_shell2(_User, _Peer) ->
 2105:     spawn(fun() ->
 2106:                   io:format("Enter command\n"),
 2107:                   read_write_loop1("> ", 1)
 2108:           end).
 2109: 
 2110: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd) ->
 2111:     spawn(fun() ->
 2112:                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
 2113:           end).
 2114: 
 2115: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd, User) ->
 2116:     spawn(fun() ->
 2117:                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 2118:           end).
 2119: 
 2120: receive_bytes(_, _, 0, _) ->
 2121:     ct:log("ALL DATA RECEIVED Budget = 0"),
 2122:     ct:log("================================ ExpectBudget = 0 (reception completed)"),
 2123:     ok;
 2124: receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Budget, AccSize) when Budget > 0 ->
 2125:     receive
 2126:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, D}} ->
 2127:             Fmt = "================================ ExpectBudget = "
 2128:                 "~p bytes Received/Total = ~p/~p bytes",
 2129:             Args = [Budget, byte_size(D), AccSize + byte_size(D)],
 2130:             ct:log(Fmt, Args),
 2131:             receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 2132:                           Budget - byte_size(D), AccSize + byte_size(D))
 2133:     after
 2134:         10000 ->
 2135:             ct:log("process_info(self(), messages) = ~p",
 2136:                    [process_info(self(), messages)]),
 2137:             ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2138:     end.
